traceability.evidence: 1. bin/dry-aged-deps.js: parses --min-age flag, validates integer 1–365, applies precedence over config file, defaults to 7. 2. bin/dry-aged-deps.js: reads .dry-aged-deps.json “minAge” (and prod/dev overrides), enforces schema and range, honors --config-file. 3. src/filter-by-age.js + test/filter-by-age.test.js: filter logic respects configurable prodMinAge/devMinAge thresholds, with dedicated tests tagged for prompts/005.0-DEV-CONFIGURABLE-AGE-THRESHOLD.md. 4. test/cli.flags.test.js: end-to-end CLI tests for --min-age: rejects non-numeric, out-of-range, missing values; defaults to 7; overrides default when provided. 5. test/cli.config-file.test.js: verifies loading minAge from config, prod/dev overrides, CLI flags overriding config, invalid JSON, unknown keys, custom config file name, missing file errors. 6. README.md documents --min-age, --prod-min-age, --dev-min-age options with correct default and help descriptions. 7. bin/dry-aged-deps.js --help output includes “--min-age= Minimum age in days (1-365) for including versions (default: 7)”. 8. JSON/XML outputs include thresholds in summary (tests in json/xml formatter suites verify summary.thresholds.prod.minAge and dev.minAge).
traceability.notes: All acceptance criteria (CLI flag, config file support, precedence, default, validation, help text, output threshold reporting) are fully implemented and covered by unit and integration tests.
